Package jdk.test.lib.hotspot.ir_framework

package jdk.test.lib.hotspot.ir_framework
  • Class Summary
    Class
    Description
    AbstractInfo
    Base info class which provides some useful utility methods and information about a test.
    IRNode
    This class provides default regex strings that can be used in @IR annotations to specify IR constraints.
    RunInfo
    Test info class which provides some useful utility methods and information about a custom run test.
    Scenario
    This class represents a scenario that can be executed by the TestFramework.
    TestFramework
    This class represents the main entry point to the test framework whose main purpose is to perform regex-based checks on the C2 IR shape emitted by the VM flags -XX:+PrintIdeal and -XX:+PrintOptoAssembly.
    TestFrameworkExecution
    This class' main method is called from TestFramework and represents the so-called "test VM".
    TestInfo
    Test info class which provides some useful utility methods and information about a checked test.
  • Enum Class Summary
    Enum Class
    Description
    Argument
    Well-defined argument values that can be used in the Arguments annotation at a Test method for a base test or a checked test.
    CheckAt
    This enum is used in Check.when() of a checked test to specify when the framework will invoke the check method after invoking the associated Test method.
    CompLevel
    Compilation levels used by the framework.
    RunMode
    The run mode for a custom run test specified in Run.mode().
  • Exception Summary
    Exception
    Description
    IRViolationException
    Exception that is thrown if an IR rule/constraint failed.
    NoTestsRunException
    Exception that is thrown by the test VM if no tests are run as a result of specifying -DTest and/or -DExclude defining an empty set with the used test VM flags.
    TestFormatException
    Exception that is thrown if a JTreg test violates the supported format by the test framework.
    TestFrameworkException
    Exception that is thrown if there is an internal error in the framework.
    TestRunException
    Exception that is thrown if the JTreg test throws an exception during the execution of individual tests of the test class.
    TestVMException
    Exception that is thrown if the test VM has thrown any kind of exception (except for TestFormatException).
  • Annotation Interfaces Summary
    Annotation Interface
    Description
    Arguments
    This annotation is used to specify well-defined Argument values for test methods (specifying Test) when used as part of a base test or checked test.
    Check
    Annotation for a check method of a checked test.
    DontCompile
    Prevent a compilation of the annotated helper method (not specifying @Test, @Check or @Run):
    DontInline
    Prevent an inlining of the annotated helper method (not specifying @Test, @Check, or @Run).
    ForceCompile
    Force a compilation of the annotated helper method (not specifying @Test, @Check or @Run) immediately at the specified level:
    ForceCompileClassInitializer
    Force a compilation of the static class initializer method (<clinit>) of the annotated test or helper class immediately at the specified level:
    ForceInline
    Force an inlining of the annotated helper method (not specifying @Test, @Check, or @Run).
    IR
    This annotation is used to define a constraint/rule/check on the resulting IR of a test method (method with @Test annotation).
    IRs
    Annotation to allow to specify multiple @IR annotations at a @Test method.
    Run
    Annotation for a run method of a custom run test.
    Test
    Annotate all methods in your test class which the framework should test with @Test.
    Warmup
    This annotation overrides the default number (2000) of times the framework should warm up a test.
